John Gruber in response to the news Windows 7 Starter Edition only allows 3 applications to run at any one time.

This is mind-blowingly stupid. I was going to say “it’s like Microsoft is going out of it’s way to frustrate and annoy users” but it’s not like anything, Microsoft actually is going out of it’s way to frustrate and annoy users.

The only possible justification for such a ridiculous limitation is “incentive” to “upgrade” to a more expensive “fully featured” edition of Windows 7. After experiencing total frustration and being effectively bribed by a crippled OS, is forking out more money for a different version of the same OS something anyone is going to feel good about?

Every Windows user I know has the it’s not that bad, I can live with it mindset. But with each new version it’s getting that bad and when you can’t listen to music while downloading a movie, reading RSS feeds and running IM living with it starts to really suck. How bad does it have to get before people will switch to fully featured, cheaper (even free!) alternatives? It can’t be long
